TopicTitle: Looking for a 1.0.5, 1.1.3, or 1.3 Kraken drive tutorial

Articles.Content: I need a tutorial on how to build Kraken Drives in the versions mentioned in the title. If someone has a download that'll fit inside a mk2 cargo bay, that would also be acceptable

Kraken drives often rely on the precise placement of certain parts, so there is no real "method" to making one. However, with some careful engineering you can exploit the "ladder glitch" which is a form of Kraken drive. Here's a video showing a working "ladder glitch" craft. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2HnkFFdV4IY
Correct me if I'm wrong, but that's quite an old video. I think that ladder glitch has been fixed...

I have found one way of creating endless momentum that I am yet to see anyone else use/find, I am still trying to find a way to get it off the ground but it spins at high speeds with no fuel or electricity. Maybe try creating some sort of helicopter with it? Anyway if you are interested here is the link to the craft file https://www.mediafire.com/?7hj9970c98xtxzg.

On 7/14/2017 at 3:05 AM, Gezzabeast said:

I have found one way of creating endless momentum that I am yet to see anyone else use/find, I am still trying to find a way to get it off the ground but it spins at high speeds with no fuel or electricity. Maybe try creating some sort of helicopter with it? Anyway if you are interested here is the link to the craft file https://www.mediafire.com/?7hj9970c98xtxzg. 

I have done a similar thing, with landing legs clipped through a lander can and elevons. Problem is, the drive only works when in contact with the ground, so it does little hops up to 30m in the air.

On 19/09/2017 at 11:21 PM, Ethen Sun said:

I have done a similar thing, with landing legs clipped through a lander can and elevons. Problem is, the drive only works when in contact with the ground, so it does little hops up to 30m in the air.

It also (kinda) works when in contact with rocket parts, but it cannot be the same ship as collision with other ships is better for some reason.
